raw_mentions:
A compound is considered to be active if it has an IC50 or Ki value of less than 1 mM for the inhibition of HIV protease or HIV viral growth or infectivity. 
Values of Ki for inhibitor binding were determined from percent activity measurements in the presence and absence of known concentration of inhibitor, using a value of 0.07 mM for the Km of the substrate (Cheng et al. (1990) Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. USA 87: 9660). 
The Ki was calculated from the formula Ki = I/(((Km+S-FA*S)/(FA*Km))-1) where I = inhibitory concentration, S = substrate concentration, FA = fractional activity = cm peak height with inhibitor/cm peak height without inhibitor, and Km = Michaelis constant = 20 µM. 
Protease was stored as a stock preparation at 10 uM in refolding buffer. 
Enzyme reaction: In a 2 ml screw-cap centrifuge tube were added 50 µl protease (final concentration 0.25 nM) and 100 µl inhibitory compound (final concentration 0.1-12,500). 
Stock solutions of 10 mM were prepared in DMSO. 
Stock solutions of 2 mM substrate were prepared in DMSO. 
Inhibitory compounds were dissolved in sufficient DMSO to make 3 mM stock solutions. 
Inhibitory compounds were dissolved in sufficient DMSO to make 2.5 or 25 mM stock solutions. 
The reaction was started with the addition of 50 µl substrate (final concentration 5 µM). 
The mobile phases were pumped at 1 ml/min, with a gradient from 0 to 30% B in 5 min, 100 % B for 4 min to wash the column, and a re-equilibration for 4 min. 
The retention time of the product was 3.6 min. 
Detection with a Shimadzu model RF535 fluorescence monitor was at 330 nm (excitation) and 430 (emission).

Here are the extracted sentences/rows that meet the criteria:


The IC<sub>90</sub> values in Table 2 are indicated as: +++ = <10 µg/ml.
In the Tables herein the Ki values were determined using the assay conditions described above under HIV Protease Inhibition Assay-HPLC Method. The Ki values are indicated as follows: +++ = <10 nM; ++ = 10 nM to 1 µM; + = >1 µM.
In the Tables herein the IC<sub>90</sub> values were determined using the assay conditions described above under HIV Low Multiplicity Assay. The IC<sub>90</sub> values are indicated as follows: +++ = <10 µg/ml; ++ = 10 to 100 µg/ml; + = >100 µg/ml.
A daily dosage of active ingredient can be expected to be 0.001 to 1000 milligrams per kilogram of body weight, with the preferred dose being 0.1

final_json.unit: milligrams per kilogram of body weight
